* The project is a product named Duke, a Personal Assistant Chatbot
* that helps a person to keep track of various things.
* Starts the chat bot by first retrieving saved file from hard disk then
* Saves the task list into the storage file when user terminates the programme.
* Parses user input and instruct corresponding classes to perform specified tasks.
* Parses user input and determine specified instructions to execute.
* @return output to be displayed to user.
public static String readInput(String input, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The task number cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The task number cannot be empty.");

throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The date of a event cannot be empty.");

* Handles the loading and saving of task lists to the hard disk.
* Searches for an existing file with a previous task list store.
* If no such file found, create a new task list.
* Writes task list into hard drive.
public static final String ADD = "\tGot it. I've added this task:\n";
public static final String BYE = "\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!";
public static final String CLEAR = "\tList cleared.";
public static final String DONE = "\tNice! I've marked this task as done:\n\t\t";
public static final String EMPTY_LIST = "\tList is empty.";
public static final String HELLO = "\tHello! I'm Duke\n\tWhat can I do for you?";
public static final String LIST = "\tHere are the tasks in your list:";
public static final String REMOVE = "\tNoted. I've removed this task:\n\t\t";
public static final String START = "Hello from\n" + LOGO;
* Task that need to be done before a specific date/time.
* Creates a task with a deadline.
* @param description task with a deadline to be completed.
* @param dateBy      date the task needs to be completed by.
* Returns the string of the task with a deadline indicating [D] for deadline followed by the description
* then do by date in MMM d yyyy.
* @return the string of the deadline task indicating [D] for deadline followed by the description
*     then do by date in MMM d yyyy.
assert dateBy != null : "Date should be stored for deadlines";
* Task that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time.
* Creates a task that is an event.
* @param description task that is an event to be completed.
* @param dateAt      date the event is at.
* Returns the string of the task that is an event indicating [E] for event followed by the description
* then date of the event in MMM d yyyy.
* @return the string of the task that is an event indicating [E] for event followed by the description
*     then date of the event in MMM d yyyy.
* Specifies main attributes and methods for tasks.
* Creates a task object with a description.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a tick for tasks marked as done and a cross for tasks not done.
* @returna tick for tasks marked as done and a cross for tasks not done.
* Changes the status of the task to done.
* TaskList stores a list of tasks and contains operations to add, retrieve
* Adds task to this task list.
* @param taskToAdd task to add to the list.
* Deletes task with the specified task number from this task list.
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! There is no such task.");
* Clears all tasks from this task list.
* Marks task with specified task number as done.
* @param taskNumber task to be marked as done.
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! There is no such task.");
* @return task with the corresponding task number.
* Returns total number of tasks in this task list.

* @return true if task list is empty and false otherwise.
* Returns information on the number of tasks in the list.
* @return the string of the total number of tasks in the list.
return "\n\tNow you have no tasks in the list.";
return String.format("\n\tNow you have %d task in the list.", getTotalTasks());
return String.format("\n\tNow you have %d tasks in the list.", getTotalTasks());
* Prints all tasks in this task list containing the keyword in a numbered order.
* @return the string of all tasks containing the keyword in this task list.
* Prints all tasks in this task list in a numbered order.
* @return the string of all tasks in this task list.
* Task without any date/time attached to it.
* Creates a task without any date/time attached to it.
* Returns the string of the task containing the description.
* @return the string of the task containing the description.
Event event = new Event("2103 lecture", LocalDate.parse("2020-01-31"));
